patterns: what is shortness of breath
describe shortness of breath
how do I know if I'm suffering from shortness of breath
What does breathlessness look like
responses: Shortness of breath can have causes that aren't due to underlying disease. Examples include exercise, altitude, tight clothing, a prolonged period of bed rest or a sedentary lifestyle. Avoiding smoking, secondhand smoke and areas with high air pollution or elevations over 5,000 feet may help ease shortness of breath.

How do I avoid covid-19?
responses: To prevent the spread of COVID-19: Maintain a safe distance from others (at least 1 metre), even if they donâ€™t appear to be sick. Wear a mask in public, especially indoors or when physical distancing is not possible. Choose open, well-ventilated spaces over closed ones. Open a window if indoors. Clean your hands often. Use soap and water, or an alcohol-based hand rub. Get vaccinated when itâ€™s your turn. Follow local guidance about vaccination. Cover your nose and mouth with your bent elbow or a tissue when you cough or sneeze. Stay home if you feel unwell.
